title: Users / Adding New Users
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Add User User Details Assigning Modules You will see a roster of present users, with the option to sort each column alphabetically. Additionally, you may utilize the search feature to locate users by their Username, Email Address, First Name, or Last Name. Clicking on a user will allow their roles and access modules to be added or removed as well as the editing of user details. Add User This opens a new blank form allowing a new user to be added. User Details Username - The name the user will use to access the Imagine portal. This could be different from a user's POS log-on details. Email Address - Used to send password reset notifications. First Name - Complete as required. Last Name - Complete as required. Language/Region - Used to set the language in Imagine. Role - See Roles for role creation, assign a role to a user here. NOTE: Role is a mandatory field, you should set up at least one Role before making a new user. Any existing users not assigned a role will require this field to be updated on any change of detail. Active User - To activate a user, check the box. To deactivate a user, uncheck it. If a user is inactive, they won't be able to access the Imagine portal. However, the currently logged-in user is not able to use this option. Tenant Administrator - To grant Tenant Admin Permissions, check the box. To revoke these permissions, uncheck it. Without being a Tenant Administrator, a user cannot access the Portal module. It's important to note that this option is not available to the currently logged-in user. Reset Password - This allows a new temporary password to be assigned to a user. They will be expected to choose a new private password at first login. Assigning Modules Please note that the user who is currently logged in is not permitted to add or remove their modules. To add or remove a module from the user, click on its respective tile. Modules that have been assigned to the user will be highlighted in blue. If a module tile displays a 'cog' icon, the user must be assigned permitted shops to access it. To do so, click on the cog icon and select the shop(s) that this user should be granted access.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Add User
  • User Details
  • Assigning Modules

You will see a roster of present users, with the option to sort each column alphabetically. Additionally, you may utilize the search feature to locate users by their Username, Email Address, First Name, or Last Name. 

 


Clicking on a user will allow their roles and access modules to be added or removed as well as the editing of user details.


Add User

This opens a new blank form allowing a new user to be added. 



User Details

Username - The name the user will use to access the Imagine portal. This could be different from a user's POS log-on details.

Email Address - Used to send password reset notifications.

First Name - Complete as required.

Last Name - Complete as required.

Language/Region - Used to set the language in Imagine.

Role - See Roles for role creation, assign a role to a user here.


NOTE: Role is a mandatory field, you should set up at least one Role before making a new user. Any existing users not assigned a role will require this field to be updated on any change of detail.


Active User - To activate a user, check the box. To deactivate a user, uncheck it. If a user is inactive, they won't be able to access the Imagine portal. However, the currently logged-in user is not able to use this option.

Tenant Administrator - To grant Tenant Admin Permissions, check the box. To revoke these permissions, uncheck it. Without being a Tenant Administrator, a user cannot access the Portal module. It's important to note that this option is not available to the currently logged-in user. 

Reset Password - This allows a new temporary password to be assigned to a user. They will be expected to choose a new private password at first login.



Assigning Modules

Please note that the user who is currently logged in is not permitted to add or remove their modules. To add or remove a module from the user, click on its respective tile. Modules that have been assigned to the user will be highlighted in blue. If a module tile displays a 'cog' icon, the user must be assigned permitted shops to access it. To do so, click on the cog icon and select the shop(s) that this user should be granted access.

title: Role Management
text: User roles are collections of permissions that can be assigned easily to multiple users. With Roles, you can generate a role with restricted access for lower-level positions, such as Sales team members, and another role with broader access for higher-level positions, such as Managers. The current roster of roles will be presented initially. To create a new role or edit an existing one, click on either the "New Role" or the chosen role. If you want to establish a new role that incorporates the permissions from an existing role with slight modifications, utilize the "Copy" option. A roster of module permissions will be shown. Details Tab Name - The name of the role i.e. Manager or Sales Team, this cannot be edited after saving. Description - You can describe to clarify the role's purpose. To search for a specific module or description, click the search icon in the Module or Description column. To enable or disable permissions for each role, check or uncheck the appropriate boxes. After selecting the necessary boxes, click "Save". In the Enabled Permissions column, you can display all permissions, only the enabled ones (True), or only the disabled ones (False). Users tab Clicking on the Users tab displays a list of all Users already assigned to this Role. You can search for a user by name.
description:
User roles are collections of permissions that can be assigned easily to multiple users. With Roles, you can generate a role with restricted access for lower-level positions, such as Sales team members, and another role with broader access for higher-level positions, such as Managers. The current roster of roles will be presented initially. 



To create a new role or edit an existing one, click on either the "New Role" or the chosen role. If you want to establish a new role that incorporates the permissions from an existing role with slight modifications, utilize the "Copy" option. A roster of module permissions will be shown. 

Details Tab

Name - The name of the role i.e. Manager or Sales Team, this cannot be edited after saving.

Description - You can describe to clarify the role's purpose. To search for a specific module or description, click the search icon in the Module or Description column. To enable or disable permissions for each role, check or uncheck the appropriate boxes. After selecting the necessary boxes, click "Save". In the Enabled Permissions column, you can display all permissions, only the enabled ones (True), or only the disabled ones (False). 



Users tab

Clicking on the Users tab displays a list of all Users already assigned to this Role. You can search for a user by name.

title: Modules
text: Modules provide an alternative to editing each user's module access individually. To modify a user's access to a module. Open the Modules section. Locate the Users column and select the user you want to modify access for. In the Modules column, the modules to which the selected user currently has access will be highlighted in blue. To grant or revoke access to a module, check or uncheck the appropriate box. If there is a Shop Access column, click on the module to access it and tick the box to allow access or mark with an 'x' to remove access. To modify access for multiple users, select them in the Users column. The Module Access list will aggregate to show which modules all selected users have access to. After selecting the necessary modules, click "Save" to save changes. Clicking "Reset" will return you to the first column, but does not reset the modules if the user is selected.
description:
Modules provide an alternative to editing each user's module access individually. 


To modify a user's access to a module.

  1. Open the Modules section.
  2. Locate the Users column and select the user you want to modify access for.
  3. In the Modules column, the modules to which the selected user currently has access will be highlighted in blue.
  4. To grant or revoke access to a module, check or uncheck the appropriate box. If there is a Shop Access column, click on the module to access it and tick the box to allow access or mark with an 'x' to remove access.
  5. To modify access for multiple users, select them in the Users column. The Module Access list will aggregate to show which modules all selected users have access to.
  6. After selecting the necessary modules, click "Save" to save changes. Clicking "Reset" will return you to the first column, but does not reset the modules if the user is selected.

title: Configuration
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS POINT OF SALE CONFIGURATION ANALYSIS CONFIGURATION TENANT CONFIGURATION INVENTORY Global Configuration Management allows you to configure settings that will impact all of your shops, meaning that these options apply across the whole of your tenant. Once you have made the necessary changes, ensure to click the "Save" button to apply and retain the modifications. It's important to note that if you leave the page without saving, the changes will not be preserved. POINT OF SALE CONFIGURATION Please note that the default setting for this feature is disabled (unchecked). If it is not enabled, the Point of Sale (POS) will not execute these actions. However, if you enable (tick) this option, the POS will perform the following actions when a barcode is scanned. For barcodes that have exactly 18 characters, the last 6 digits represent the item's new price. The first and second numbers are swapped, as are the third and fourth, but the fifth and sixth numbers remain in the same position. For instance, if the barcode is "123456789012123456", the price of the item is "2143.56". If the 6th character in an 18-character barcode is "9", the POS will use the following 6 characters as a search query to match against the item numbers in the item list. For instance, if the barcode is "123459111111000000", the POS will initiate a search to find the item with an Item Number of "111111". ANALYSIS CONFIGURATION Global Configuration Management is linked to the output of rows for the Analysis module. The default amount of rows 10000 (Ten Thousand) The minimum number of rows is 1000 (One Thousand) The maximum number of rows is 10000000 (Ten Million) If you choose a value outside of these parameters, you will be shown a warning TENANT CONFIGURATION The Serial Number Mask specifies the serial number format. When a serial number or item barcode is scanned or entered manually, its format is checked against the Serial Number Mask to identify whether it is a serial number, item number, or none of these. If you wish to use this feature you should check the Enable Serial Number Tracking option. SERIAL NUMBER MASK EXAMPLES 1. If your serial numbers consistently have the same format (e.g., always 18 characters long and begin with the number combination 50361), you should set the Serial Number Mask to "50361?????????????". This ensures that all serial numbers will start with "50361" and be 18 characters in length. 2. If your serial numbers always start with the same number combination (e.g., 50361) but have varying lengths, you can represent this format using "50361*". This means that all serial numbers will start with "50361" and can be followed by any number of characters greater than zero. 3. If all your serial numbers have the same format and are always 12 characters long, you should set the Serial Number Mask to "????????????". This indicates that all serial numbers will have 12 characters with no specific prefix or suffix. 4. If your stock items are from different manufacturers who use different serial number formats, and your serial numbers do not have a consistent format in terms of characters or length, you should set the Serial Number Mask to "*". This indicates that serial numbers can have any combination of characters and lengths. INVENTORY Allow Placed purchased orders to be changed Please note that the default setting for this feature is disabled (unchecked). If it is not enabled, editing Quantity and Cost in Purchase Orders that have a status of 'Placed' will not be possible. However, if you enable (tick) this option, PO's with a status of 'Placed' will allow you to alter Quantity and Cost values.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • POINT OF SALE CONFIGURATION
  • ANALYSIS CONFIGURATION
  • TENANT CONFIGURATION
  • INVENTORY


Global Configuration Management allows you to configure settings that will impact all of your shops, meaning that these options apply across the whole of your tenant. 


Once you have made the necessary changes, ensure to click the "Save" button to apply and retain the modifications. It's important to note that if you leave the page without saving, the changes will not be preserved. 



POINT OF SALE CONFIGURATION

Please note that the default setting for this feature is disabled (unchecked). If it is not enabled, the Point of Sale (POS) will not execute these actions.

However, if you enable (tick) this option, the POS will perform the following actions when a barcode is scanned.


 

  • For barcodes that have exactly 18 characters, the last 6 digits represent the item's new price. The first and second numbers are swapped, as are the third and fourth, but the fifth and sixth numbers remain in the same position. For instance, if the barcode is "123456789012123456", the price of the item is "2143.56". 
  • If the 6th character in an 18-character barcode is "9", the POS will use the following 6 characters as a search query to match against the item numbers in the item list. For instance, if the barcode is "123459111111000000", the POS will initiate a search to find the item with an Item Number of "111111". 

ANALYSIS CONFIGURATION

Global Configuration Management is linked to the output of rows for the Analysis module. 


The default amount of rows 10000 (Ten Thousand)

The minimum number of rows is 1000 (One Thousand)

The maximum number of rows is 10000000 (Ten Million)

If you choose a value outside of these parameters, you will be shown a warning



TENANT CONFIGURATION


The Serial Number Mask specifies the serial number format.

When a serial number or item barcode is scanned or entered manually, its format is checked against the Serial Number Mask to identify whether it is a serial number, item number, or none of these.

If you wish to use this feature you should check the Enable Serial Number Tracking option.



SERIAL NUMBER MASK EXAMPLES


1. If your serial numbers consistently have the same format (e.g., always 18 characters long and begin with the number combination 50361), you should set the Serial Number Mask to "50361?????????????". This ensures that all serial numbers will start with "50361" and be 18 characters in length. 









2. If your serial numbers always start with the same number combination (e.g., 50361) but have varying lengths, you can represent this format using "50361*". This means that all serial numbers will start with "50361" and can be followed by any number of characters greater than zero. 



3. If all your serial numbers have the same format and are always 12 characters long, you should set the Serial Number Mask to "????????????". This indicates that all serial numbers will have 12 characters with no specific prefix or suffix.




4. If your stock items are from different manufacturers who use different serial number formats, and your serial numbers do not have a consistent format in terms of characters or length, you should set the Serial Number Mask to "*". This indicates that serial numbers can have any combination of characters and lengths.



INVENTORY

Allow Placed purchased orders to be changed

  • Please note that the default setting for this feature is disabled (unchecked). If it is not enabled, editing Quantity and Cost in Purchase Orders that have a status of 'Placed' will not be possible.
  • However, if you enable (tick) this option, PO's with a status of 'Placed' will allow you to alter Quantity and Cost values.

title: User Shop Groups
text: User Shop Groups allow for multiple locations to be assigned to named groups. To create a new User Group click on "Create New". 1. A new window will open. Provide a name for the group. 2. From the "Shops" drop-down menu, select the required locations previously created in the "Shops" section. Note: A minimum of 2 shops must be selected. 3. Click Save. You will be returned to the main page, where the newly created group will be displayed. To delete a Group, follow these steps: 1. Click on the Bin icon. 2. A warning message will appear. 3. Click Yes to confirm the removal of the Group. Clicking No will cancel the deletion.
description:
User Shop Groups allow for multiple locations to be assigned to named groups. To create a new User Group click on "Create New".




1. A new window will open. Provide a name for the group.

2. From the "Shops" drop-down menu, select the required locations previously created in the "Shops" section.

   Note: A minimum of 2 shops must be selected.



3. Click Save. You will be returned to the main page, where the newly created group will be displayed.



To delete a Group, follow these steps:

1. Click on the Bin icon.

2. A warning message will appear.

3. Click Yes to confirm the removal of the Group. Clicking No will cancel the deletion.
